title: Crispy Orange Beef Recipe
description: This orange beef recipe features top sirloin stir-fried until crispy, then cooked in a sweet and savory citrus sauce flavored with ginger and garlic.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Crispy Orange Beef 4.5 (1,066) 794 Reviews 91 Photos A delicious orange beef recipe that is crispy and sweet yet mildly spiced. This beef stir-fry recipe is great served with steamed rice and broccoli. Submitted by BEC Updated on August 29, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 91 91 91 91 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 ½ pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced 2 cups water 1 cup long grain rice ⅓ cup white sugar ⅓ cup rice wine vinegar 2 tablespoons frozen orange juice concentrate 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 teaspoon salt 2 cups oil for frying ¼ cup cornstarch 3 tablespoons grated fresh ginger 1 ½ tablespoons minced garlic 2 teaspoons orange zest 8 broccoli florets, lightly steamed or blanched Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Lay beef in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with paper towels. Allow to dry in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, bring water and rice to a boil in a medium saucepan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together sugar, rice vinegar, orange juice concentrate, soy sauce, and salt in a small bowl. Set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Toss dried beef in cornstarch to coat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Fry coated beef in hot oil in small batches until crispy and golden brown; set aside. Drain oil from the wok, leaving about 1 tablespoon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add ginger, garlic, and orange zest to remaining oil in wok. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook and stir briefly until fragrant. Pour in soy sauce mixture; bring to a boil and cook until thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in fried beef and cook until heated through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot over steamed rice and garnish with broccoli. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,609 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 507 Calories 19g Fat 59g Carbs 27g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 507 % Daily Value * Total Fat 19g 24% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 61mg 20% Sodium 651mg 28% Total Carbohydrate 59g 22% Dietary Fiber 6g 21% Total Sugars 17g Protein 27g 55% Vitamin C 189mg 210% Calcium 122mg 9% Iron 5mg 27% Potassium 983mg 21% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Crispy Orange Beef 01 of 91 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 91 Photo by  JanetOSully 01/11/2025 Loved it! Definitely going to make it again! Very simple directions, easy to find ingredient and great results. 03 of 91 Photo by  RowdyPork1021 03/23/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Crowd-pleaser Followed it to the letter.It was great. Flavor was fantastic. Hubby was very pleased. 04 of 91 Photo by  Dave Bloomquist 09/05/2021 It came out perfect and delicious exactly as you listed the recipe. Wonderful job! 05 of 91 Photo by  Denise Woods-Thomson 07/22/2021 06 of 91 Photo by  Jamie 03/03/2021 I used a pound of shaved beef from our grocery store- so thin I feared it would be a disaster! I shook in cornstarch and laid flat to “dry” while I chopped everything else. Followed the recipe exactly with a few exceptions- I used half the sugar as suggested by others, and a dash of dried red pepper flakes. Used a tablespoon of peanut oil with a drop of sesame oil for frying. 07 of 91 Photo by  Angelo Fresco 02/01/2021 08 of 91 Photo by  Kwalfoort 01/28/2021 09 of 91 Photo by  Mitch 01/22/2021 This was disappointing; way to much orange taste and came out bitter, with 1/3 cup of sugar you would think differently. I will try again but with no Orange so I guess it will be Ginger Beef. lol 10 of 91 Photo by  Foodie 12/24/2020 Love the recipe but made some adjustments, for example, less sugar, and added baking soda in the marinade and sat for 3 hours or more. I used the fresh mandarin orange peels and sliced into thin slices instead of zest. I found it more flavourful and I used fresh orange juice with pulp instead of frozen concentrate.
